intro: Tillaea mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian tillia, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, featuring succulent leaves that help reduce water loss. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Tillaea mongolica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
